string.text: Information: Classified
Information: Classified 'Extremely Dangerous'
Ordinary Soldier. Further details unavailable at present
Leader within the Monolith Faction. Best left alone. Extremely Dangerous. Detailed information unavailable
Member of the Monolith faction. Sniper Division. Detailed information unavailable
Member of the Monolith Faction. Extremely well equipped. Detailed information unavailable
Militant from the Monolith grouping. Well equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Commander of the military raid
Military Stalker. Well armed and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Details unavailable at present
Army Spetsnaz. Well equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Vasil Luckless
Army Spetsnaz. Well equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Former miner who now raids every deserted laboratory and bunker he and his associates can find
Mole
One of the participants of the deadly fights in the Arena. No details available
Experienced smuggler. Earned his fame by smuggling hundreds of stuffed mutants out of the restricted area within a very short period of time
Arnie
Bouncer at the Bar, or if you prefer, the Barkeep's bodyguard. Nothing more is known about his present or his past
Garik
Garik's twin brother. Bouncer at the bar. As close-mouthed as his brother
Zhorik

A very successful trader, and the proprietor of the '100 Rads' bar in Rostok, Barkeep has earned respect and influence throughout the Zone. He cooperates with Sidorovich in a mutual bid to open the roads to the center of the Zone. According to him, he used to own a restaurant back in Ukraine, where he was constantly being harassed by the Mob for protection back in 1994. He now has a personal vendetta against the same mob who previously extorted him, and is on a mission to wipe them out. They have an operation at the Agroprom Research Institute, selling artefacts from the Zone to the outside world
Barkeep
Beast

Member of the Duty faction, more often off the wagon than on it. Duty gave him his last chance for redemption by carrying out a mission. However, he ended up too drunk to get himself together and pull it off
Brome

Good-natured, cheerful guy whose only problem is that he can't shoot with anything but a hunting rifle, simply because he's never tried another gun. He recently got into a scrap in the Wild Territory, and lost the rifle handed down to him from his family. Now he lounges about the Bar, hoping to find someone who will not just find his rifle, but return it to him...
Hunter

Smarmy know-it-all Stalker who trades information at the Bar, and has probably never set foot outside it since he came into the Zone. Claims to be ex-military, but you get the impression he's never fired a weapon in his life, other than to save his own hide. Much of his 'valuable info' is based on hearsay picked up there, and is often misleading, if not downright fictitious...
Snitch
Commander of all 'retribution' raids, and expeditions against mutant hordes
Captain Ivantsov
Sergeant Kitsenko
The Arena owner's bodyguard. Little is known about his past, but you can safely assume that all of it's bad. He hates his brothers
Liolik
Baldy
One of Duty's founders and their leading idea-monger. Largely responsible for writing its code of honour and duty
Colonel Petrenko
Chief of Duty territory's security
Sergeant Plichko
Stranger affected by the Brain Scorcher
Spotty
The current leader of Duty, and one of its original founders. He personally recruited most of the faction's key members, and is responsible for upholding its sacred code
General Voronin
Alkie
Unknown Stalker. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown Stalker. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present
One of the bandit leaders. Well armed and highly dangerous. No details available
Borziy
Doc
Doc
Unknown mercenary. Well armed and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown mercenary. Potentially well armed. Further details unavailable at present
Leader of the Merc gang. Well armed and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Dushman
Experienced Stalker. Further details unavailable at present
Vasily Petrovich
No information available
Experienced Stalker. Always on the alert...
Zheka Doublet
Kalugin P.I.
Regular sergeant in the Ukrainian Army. Further details unavailable at present
Regular private in the Ukrainian Army. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown Stalker. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present
Long serving captain of the Ukrainian Army. Further details unavailable at present
Took over leadership at the Rookie camp after Wolf. Purposeful, aggressive, and has well-deserved authority over newcomers
Fanatic
Old loner toughened by the Zone
Fox
Unknown mercenary. Potentially well armed. Further details unavailable at present
Smart rookie. Wolf seems to like him, and often sends him on important missions
Petruha

A veteran and a living legend who has travelled the length and breadth of the Zone. They say he can take you to absolutely any place within it. His services are costly and not available to just anyone, because if he doesn't take to you, he won't help you for all the money in the world...
Guide
Regular sergeant in the Ukrainian Army. Further details unavailable at present
A truly indispensable Stalker who made his name by keeping himself practically invisible. The trader turns to him for sensitive missions such as spying on someone, snooping around, and eavesdropping
Nimble
Major commanding the army outpost by the bridge. Well-known for taking bribes from Stalkers, to let them pass under the bridge
Major Kuznetsov
Regular private in the Ukrainian Army. Further details unavailable at present
Spetsnaz. Well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown mercenary. Well-armed and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Rookie. New to the Zone. Further details unavailable at present
Typical Stalker
Tolik
Head of the Rookie camp. An old Stalker making his plans to bail out
Wolf

Has been making his living since childhood by trading. In kindergarten, he used to sell crayons. In high school, he sold chewing gum. At the Institute, he dealt in light drugs. As soon as the Zone came to be, he realized its money-making potential. Well-known for his ability to build strong trade relations with any group of clients, no matter how unsavoury or dangerous
Sidorovich
Has a certain authority over the bandits in the Zone. Borov's sidekick
Vasya Boar
A Stalker from the Duty faction. Further details unavailable at present
Officer in the Duty faction. Further details unavailable at present
Prapor
Rookie. Trying to break new ground in the Zone
Yurek
Hiding in the Zone from the law. Tries to maintain order in the Zone on his own terms, and fights against the bandits. Can be cruel, but is always fair
Bes
Rookie. New to the Zone. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker whose face is as dirty as his conscience
Seriy
An experienced Stalker. Further details unavailable at present
Militant from the Duty faction. Usually well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Commander of Duty's Special Forces. Usually well-equipped
Skull
A fighter from the Duty faction. Usually well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present
A stool pigeon known across the whole Zone
Ara
Unknown mercenary. Well armed and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown mercenary. Apparently new to the Zone. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown mercenary. Potentially well-armed. Further details unavailable at present
Sentinel of the Monolith grouping. Best to stay away from him. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. Further details unavailable at present
One of the veterans of the Zone, and knows it like the back of his hand. Usually well-equipped and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Veteran Stalker. Potentially well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker from the Freedom faction. Barrier commander who banded together a group of people willing to dedicate their lives to a greater cause
Cap
Bodyguard working for Lukash, the leader of Freedom
Freedom's chef. A boozer and brawler, but an excellent cook
Cook
A mechanic renowned throughout the Zone. Can make a tank out of a tractor, or so the story goes...
Screw
Leader of the Freedom faction
Lukash
Commander of the Freedom faction. Further details unavailable at present
A fanatical guard from the Freedom faction. Very well-equipped and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Max
Guard from the Freedom faction. Very well-equipped and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Murk
Stalker from the Freedom faction. Further details unavailable at present
Sniper from the Freedom faction. Further details unavailable at present
Militant from the Freedom faction. Usually well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker from the Freedom faction. Further details unavailable at present
Pavlik
Infamous for his stinginess and high prices, but they say he can get you anything
Miser
Stalker from the Freedom faction. Further details unavailable at present
Insane Stalker from the Freedom faction
Militant from the Freedom faction. Usually well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Sasha Bely

One of the Zone's veterans, and knows it like the palm of his hand. Usually well-equipped and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Veteran Stalker. Possibly well equipped. No details available
Commander of the Freedom faction. Further details unavailable at present
A Stalker whose luck finally ran out...
A researcher from the mobile lab. Further details unavailable at present
Scientific expert on anomalous phenomena. Worked in the US on top secret government projects. Has been reported missing for a while now...
Freeman
Looter and murderer with a price on his head. Formerly on good terms with Duty, when he helped them win over their territory. Now dwells in the Wild Territory, and mugs lone Stalkers with his gang
Lucky
Ph.D in biology. Studied pathogenic mutations in animals outside the Zone. Came to the Zone to study blind dogs in particular
Professor Kruglov
One of the 'heroes' of the Merc gang. A veteran who's had bullets of every calibre pass through his body. A rare psychopath and sadist
Tirana
The leader of the gang calling themselves 'The Curs', and one of the first field commanders of the Mercs. An anarchist despising all laws except that of the jungle...
Wolfhound
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker from the Monolith's special 'Crystal' group. Responsible for the safety of the Monolith itself
Arnie
Beast
Vasya 'Boar'
A psychomaterial form created by the Monolith
Borov
Insane Stalker

This unfortunate Stalker saw something in the Bloodsucker Village that not only drove him insane, but made him extremely paranoid thereafter. After running away from the village, he holed up in a cabin near a small marsh just outside the Army Warehouses, and shooting anything or anyone who came too close
Prapor
Security Chief

Wolf
Unknown Stalker. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown Stalker. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present

Came to the Zone looking for adventure, and imitates characters from popular comics of the 60's. Uses various aliases: Badman, Macho, the Black Coat, Banderos. Even though he's survived in the Zone for a full two years, nobody really takes him seriously, which constantly drives him mad...

Fierce, wicked, crude, selfish, cruel and cold-hearted, nobody knows when and how he got to the Zone. Feared by everyone, he has no friends or allies. With no past, and no future, he simply lives in the Zone. After one of his numerous forays into the Zone, he lost his memory, forgetting almost everything. He doesn't remember his real name, nor where he comes from. Suffering from frequent lapses of short term memory, he's been known to completely forget a new acquaintance within an hour. Most Stalkers will advise you to treat him as an enemy, and kill him before he tries to do the same to you
Unknown Stalker. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown Stalker. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present
Guard from the Duty faction. If you're not their friend, then stay away from them. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker from the Duty faction. Further details unavailable at present
Militant from the Duty faction. Usually well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present

A sad bootlicker, hypocrite and coward, Barin's motto could well be 'After us, the deluge'. Takes advantage of any situation for himself. Extremely ambitious and touchy. He came to the Zone, unsurprisingly, for money. Two years later he's been procurring material assets by all possible means
Militant from the Duty faction. Usually well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present

Official recruiter for the Ukrainian Security Service, and a frequent visitor to the Bar. Everyone knows him, and that he's a good man to turn to when you fall on hard times. In his eyes, however, once you cross the line there is no way back to the ranks of honest Stalkers

In everyday life a phlegmatic who keeps his emotions to himself and always stays cool. However, when under stress he gets peppery and aggressive. A highly intellectual materialist who regrets coming to the Zone in the first place. After graduating from medical university, he was sent into the Zone as a neurosurgical assistant at the scientists' camp. Now dissects mutant brains and researches their psychokinetic properties. He's looking forward to his retirement, when he can move back to the capital, as far away as possible from this disgusting place
A Stalker whose luck finally ran out...
Unknown mercenary. Potentially well-armed. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown mercenary. Potentially well-armed. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown mercenary. Potentially well-armed. Further details unavailable at present
Unknown mercenary. Potentially well-armed. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. Further details unavailable at present
Stalker from the Monolith grouping. Further details unavailable at present
Further details unavailable at present
Military Stalker. Well armed and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present
Regular soldier. Further details unavailable at present
Further details unavailable at present
Spetsnaz. Well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Experienced Stalker. Further details unavailable at present

A Stalker born under an unusually ambivalent lucky star. On numerous occasions, the teams he was with would end up in a tight spot and, each time, he'd be the only survivor. Most Stalkers stay away from him on account of the bad luck he's said to carry. Has been roaming the Zone on his own for quite some time now...
One of the Zone's veterans, and knows it like the back of his hand. Usually well-equipped and highly dangerous. Further details unavailable at present

Experienced smuggler who plied his trade in Africa and South America before news of the Chernobyl disaster brought him to the Ukraine. In a short while, he managed to smuggle hundreds of stuffed mutants out of the restricted area, earning himself the nickname 'Taxidermist'. When not 'working' in the Zone, he's a successful trader who loves extravagant suits, fancy ties, and Soviet weaponry

Served in the war against Afghanistan. Formerly an atheist, after surviving a Mujahideen ambush he emerged a religious man. After the war he emigrated to Poland, where he enrolled at a theological seminary. After graduating, he preached at the Catholic church in Lviv. When news of the explosion at the Chernobyl NPP emerged, he volunteered to go in and help the victims. The Zone is now his ministry, where he can be found preaching his understanding of the Zone as part of a 'bigger picture'. This of course, has made him enemies of a different kind...

Formerly a mechanic at the 'Kholod Mac' plant, he decided to take his own life after his wife left him. However, being deeply religious, he chose the Zone as an unconventional means of suicide, and threw himself at 'God's mercy'. Contrary to his expectations, he survived, and has since gained invaluable experience and the respect of other Stalkers due to his professional skills and attitude. Master is probably the most qualified mechanic in the Zone in terms of equipment and vehicles, although installing security systems in bunkers is what he does best. A simple, stern man, though a bit rough at times, he is welcome everywhere he goes, since he leaves every place better than he found it...

Lieutenant Colonel in the Ministry of Interior troops, and a former military Stalker. The only soldier to return from a disastrous operation deep in the Zone, to discover that the mission was pointless and suicidal from the start. That's when he decided not to leave the Zone, staged his own death, and joined the Stalkers in a place he'd grown to love. Quiet, cynical, and filled with purpose
Rookie. New to the Zone. Further details unavailable at present

20 years old, Klutz lost everything and everyone in the Big Land before deciding to come here. He barely makes a living in the Zone, but simply has nowhere else to go. Frequents excursions into the Zone, but never travels alone, choosing always to accompany a group of experienced Stalkers. Not a popular companion, however, as more often than not he's just plain useless, and scarcely makes any money. Lives on handouts from other Stalkers, and is deeply in debt to many of them
Veteran Stalker. Potentially well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present
Veteran Stalker. Potentially well-equipped. Further details unavailable at present

A former 'Black Beret', Oleg 'The Fiend' Gusarov served in the Belotserkovskaya Spetsnaz brigade. Served in multiple tours as a sniper and bomb technician, eventually rising to Master Sergeant. A loner at heart, he rarely ventures into the Zone as part of a group, preferring to work alone. He has been invited to join the clans numerous times, but has always refused

A student from the Department of Physics who dropped out of his senior year to search out easy money in the Zone. Likes to show off his 'scientific' knowledge, and offer discourses on abstract philosophical issues, which is reason enough for other Stalkers to dislike him. Overall, a reasonably decent fellow challenged by his idealistic theories

27 years old, Sparrow is cunning and farseeing - but also capable of the most horrendous blunders. A scrawny, pallid type with a rather dubious persona, he can come over as mean-spirited. Came to the Zone purely out of curiosity, promising himself he'd return home after two months, but never did. On his very first sally into the Zone, Sparrow walked across a field strewn with anomalies without wearing any protection, and totally clueless as to how dangerous that was. Later, on learning what he'd done, he passed out. Since then, he celebrates that date (09 Oct) as his rebirthday
Master of the Freedom faction. No details available
Stalker from the Freedom faction. No details available
Stalker from the Freedom faction. No details available
Militant from the Freedom faction. Usually well equipped. No details available

Leshiy, as his brother calls him, arrived as a young idealist into the Zone. However, several years of living a hair's breadth away from death turned him into a cynical realist. Considers the Zone his true home, and believes that those who failed here are unworthy to walk the face of the Earth
A former journalist, he sketches and writes stories about the Zone under the name of 'Arkady'. Meticulous, harsh, but fair, he is widely respected by the Stalkers he describes
A Stalker whose unusual run of luck finally ran out
A fresh Stalker whose luck ran out quickly
An experienced Stalker whose luck ran out
Bandit guard. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present
Regular bandit. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present
Rookie bandit. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present
Experienced bandit. Unsavoury reputation. Further details unavailable at present

Starting out as a barman for the Bandits, Borov later took Yoga's position as the leading bandit in the Zone. Borov states that he is a natural born leader, knowing even when he was a kid that he was destined to become one. His fellow bandits, however, call him an 'aristocrat wannabe', amongst other things
Borov
Stalker from the Duty faction. Further details unavailable at present

Ghost
Veteran researcher of the Zone. Participated in the first expeditions to the Exclusion Zone in 2007
Researcher. Further details unavailable at present
